/wiki/La_casa_del_pel%C3%ADcano: La casa del pelícano ("The House of the Pelican") is a 1976 Mexican thriller film. It was shot in 1976 and released in 1977. Main themes of this film are rape and difficult possessive relationship between mother and her son.
/wiki/Te_quiero_(film): Te Quiero (English: I love you) is a Mexican motion picture categorized as drama and romance. It was filmed in 1978 and released in 1979.
/wiki/Tres_mujeres_en_la_hoguera: Tres mujeres en la hoguera (English: Three women in a bonfire) is a 1976 Mexican drama and thriller film.
/wiki/Puerto_maldito: Puerto Maldito (English: Damned Port) is a Mexican motion picture categorized as action and adventure. It was filmed in 1977 and released in 1978.
/wiki/El_a%C3%B1o_de_la_peste: El Año de la Peste (English: The year of the plague) is a Mexican motion picture categorized as drama, thriller and Sci-Fi. It was filmed in 1978 and released in 1979. The production counted with the famous Colombian writer Gabriel García Márquez for the adapted screenplay from the novel of Daniel Defoe A Journal of the Plague Year published in March 1722.
/wiki/Frontera_(1980_film): Frontera (English: Frontier) is a Mexican motion picture categorized as action and thriller. It was filmed in 1979 and released in 1980.
/wiki/Novia,_esposa_y_amante: Novia, Esposa y Amante (English: Girlfriend, wife and lover) is a Mexican motion picture categorized as drama and romance film released in 1980.
/wiki/One_Man%27s_Hero: One Man's Hero is a 1999 historical war drama film directed by Lance Hool and starring Tom Berenger, Joaquim de Almeida and Daniela Romo. The film has the distinction of being the last film released by Orion Pictures' arthouse division Orion Classics, as well as being the last Orion Pictures film, until 2013's Grace Unplugged, when Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer revived the Orion Pictures brand.
